Is it connected via DVI or RGB?: But there is a DVI to RGB adapter between the PC and the cable going to the KVM
Normally when you connect via DVI the computer can get information about your monitors capabilities EDID.
seems like I should be able to force Ubuntu to just understand that my monitor can do 1280x1024

Because you're using a converter your monitor is not able to get this data.  You can export it though whilst connected to it via DVI and then manually specify it in your Xorg using the "CustomEDID" option.
that sounds like a great idea.
would that be done with the *gasp* CLI?
Do you have an nvidia graphics card?
